channel.title: Columbia River on Roadsign Pictures
channel.description: Recent content in Columbia River on Roadsign Pictures

item.title: US-197 North - Entering Washington
item.description: Entering Washington on US-197 North. Taken on a bridge over the Columbia River.

item.title: US-2 West/US-97 South Approaching US-97 Alt. North
item.description: US-2 West/US-97 South approaching US-97 Alt. North to Entiat and Chelan. Entering Chelan County and crossing the Columbia River.

item.title: I-84 West Approaching Exit 137
item.description: I-84 West approaching Exit 137 (OR-19 South). Use OR-19 south for John Day and Fossil. The Columbia River is in the background of the photograph, as well as the windmills that dot this area of the gorge.

item.title: US-395 South - Kennewick
item.description: Entering Kennewick on US-395 south crossing the Columbia River on the Blue Bridge. Kennewick is one of the tri-cities of Washington, the other two being Pasco and Richland.

item.title: WA-285 North - Senator George Sellar Bridge
item.description: WA-285 North on the Senator George Sellar Bridge over the Columbia River. Approaching Wenatchee Ave./Ferry St./Malaga-Alcoa Highway.

item.title: WA-285 North - Chelan County
item.description: Entering Chelan County on the Columbia River bridge on WA-285 north. Also entering Wenatchee, the county seat of Chelan County.

item.title: US-97 South - Entering Oregon
item.description: Entering Oregon on US-97 south, crossing the Columbia River.

item.title: US-97 North at I-84 Frontage Road
item.description: I-84 north at I-84 Frontage Road, and approaching I-84/US-30 junction. Turn left on the Frontage Road for Deschutes State Park. Continue north on US-97 for I-84 junction, and Yakima (Washington). The Columbia River and Washington state are in the background of the photograph.

item.title: I-84 West - Exit 22
item.description: I-84 west at Exit 22 - Corbett. The Columbia River is in the background of the photograph.

item.title: I-84 West - Exit 29
item.description: I-84 west at Exit 29 - Dalton Point. Access to Dalton Point State Recreation Park, located on the Columbia River.

item.title: I-84/US-30 - Philippi Canyon
item.description: I-84/US-30 at Exit 123 interchange. Turn right for Phillipi Canyon. The Columbia River is in the background.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 88
item.description: I-84 east at Exit 88 - The Dalles Dam. The Dalles Dam is the second dam on the Columbia River from the Pacific Ocean.

item.title: WA-17 South Approaching WA-173 North
item.description: WA-17 south approaching WA-173 North/Bridgeport/Brewster. Crossing the Columbia River into Douglas County.

item.title: I-5 North - Exit 1A and Exit 1B (Washington)
item.description: I-5 north approaching Washington Exit 1A - WA-14 East/Camas and Exit 1B - City Center/6th St./Convention Center. Taken on Interstate Bridge over Columbia River.

item.title: I-84 West - Exit 88
item.description: I-84 west approaching Exit 88 - The Dalles Dam

item.title: I-84 West - Exit 97
item.description: I-84 west approaching Exit 97 - OR-206/Celilo Park

item.title: I-84 West - Exit 104
item.description: I-84 west approaching Exit 104 - US-97/Yakima/Bend

item.title: I-84 West - Exit 109
item.description: I-84 west at Exit 109 - Rufus/John Day Dam

item.title: I-84 West - Exit 123
item.description: I-84 west approaching Exit 123 - Philippi Canyon

item.title: I-84 West - Exit 129
item.description: I-84 west approaching Exit 129 - Blalock Canyon

item.title: I-82 East - Exit 1 (Oregon)
item.description: I-82 east on the Columbia River bridge approaching Oregon Exit 1, To US-395/US-730/Hermiston/Umatilla.

item.title: Bridge Of The Gods - WA-14
item.description: End of the Bridge of the Gods at WA-14, and Welcome To Washington sign.

item.title: End WA-409 - 200 Feet
item.description: End WA-409 in 200 feet at the Puget Island Ferry dock.

item.title: End WA-409 - Puget Island Ferry
item.description: History of Puget Island Ferry at end of WA-409, on the ferry dock.

item.title: End WA-409 - Puget Island Ferry Fees
item.description: Ferry schedule and fares for Puget Island Ferry, which goes across the Columbia River to Westport, OR. Current auto fare: $3.00

item.title: End WA-409 200 Feet
item.description: End WA-409 in 200 feet at the Puget Island Ferry dock.

item.title: Ferry Ramp - Welcome To Washington
item.description: Welcome To Washington sign looking up ramp from Puget Island Ferry on WA-409.

item.title: I-5 North - Entering Washington
item.description: Entering Washington on I-5 north, on the Interstate Bridge over the Columbia River.

item.title: I-5 North Exit 1A/Vancouver Exits
item.description: I-5 north approaching Exit 1A (WA) WA-14/Camas, and overhead for next three Vancouver exits. Taken at foot of Interstate Bridge on the Columbia River.

item.title: I-82 East Exit 1 (Oregon)
item.description: I-82 east on the Columbia River bridge approaching Oregon Exit 1, To US-395/US-730/Hermiston/Umatilla.

item.title: I-84 West Exit 104
item.description: I-84 west approaching Exit 104, US-97/Yakima/Bend, 1 mile.

item.title: I-84 West Exit 123
item.description: I-84 west approaching Exit 123, Philippi Canyon, 1 mile.

item.title: I-84 West Exit 129
item.description: I-84 west approaching Exit 129, Blalock Canyon, 3/4 mile.

item.title: I-84/US-30 West Onramp Exit 123
item.description: I-84/US-30 West freeway entrance to The Dalles, at Exit 123.

item.title: US-101 South at WA-401
item.description: US-101 south approaching Astoria Megler Bridge to US-30.

item.title: US-101 South at WA-401 to Longview
item.description: US-101 south at WA-401 north to Longview.

item.title: US-30 - Bridge Of The Gods Jct.
item.description: US-30 west at Bridge of the Gods to Camas and Stevenson.

item.title: WA-14 East at WA-142 East
item.description: WA-14 east approaching WA-142 East to Klickitat and Wahkiacus, 1/2 mile.

item.title: WA-409 - Welcome To Washington
item.description: Welcome To Washington at end of ramp from Puget Island Ferry on WA-409.

item.title: Welcome To Washington - Puget Island Ferry
item.description: Closeup of Welcome To Washington sign at end of ramp from Puget Island Ferry on WA-409.

item.title: US-730 West - Speed 55
item.description: US-730 West - Speed 55 in Umatilla County. This is a standard type of speed limit sign in Oregon, especially on two lane highways. The idea is that only the world Speed (and not limit) invokes the Oregon Basic Speed Law instead of a hard and fast limit.
